audio.processing.modulation

Class SinusoidalLFO

  • java.lang.Object
    • audio.processing.modulation.SinusoidalLFO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LFO

    public class SinusoidalLFO
extends java.lang.Object
implements LFO
    This class implements the LFO interface and creates a low frequency oscillator with a sinusoidal oscillation pattern.
    See Also:
    LFO, trianagularLFO, VariableDelay, VariableDelayEffect

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void advance()
      Advances the waveform.
      double getDouble()
      Returns the value of theta * amplitude as a double
      int getInt()
      This method takes the value returned by the getDouble method and uses the Math.rint(double) to return the integer value that is closest in value to getDouble() and is equal to a mathematical integer.
      void setAmplitude(double amplitude)
      Method simply sets the size of the amplitude and thus decides the amplitude (ie sets the maximum 'peak' value and minimum 'trough' value) of the sinusoidal waveform
      void setPeriod(int period)
      Method simply sets the size of the oscillation period.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(int period)
        Method simply sets the size of the oscillation period. If the sample rate of an audio file is 44100 then a period set to 44100 corresponds to 1 second per oscillation
        Specified by:
        setPeriod in interface LFO
        Parameters:
        period - value to set the size of the oscillation

      • setAmplitude

        public void setAmplitude(double amplitude)
        Method simply sets the size of the amplitude and thus decides the amplitude (ie sets the maximum 'peak' value and minimum 'trough' value) of the sinusoidal waveform
        Specified by:
        setAmplitude in interface LFO
        Parameters:
        amplitude - value to set the size of the amplitude of the waveform

      • advance

        public void advance()
        Advances the waveform. This is called for each sample in an array and actually creates the sinusoidal waveform using the forumla "theta = theta + (2*PI/period);"
        Specified by:
        advance in interface LFO

      • getDouble

        public double getDouble()
        Returns the value of theta * amplitude as a double
        Specified by:
        getDouble in interface LFO
        Returns:
        the value of theta (the 'x' value of theta) multiplied by the amplitude ('y' value)

      • getInt

        public int getInt()
        This method takes the value returned by the getDouble method and uses the Math.rint(double) to return the integer value that is closest in value to getDouble() and is equal to a mathematical integer. This double is cast as an integer and returned.
        Specified by:
        getInt in interface LFO
        Returns:
        the closest integer to the value returned in getDouble()
